properties.name: Advice
properties.location: the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins.

This Advice replaces Advice issued on 1.17pm, 30 December 2024.

Burning out operations may be undertaken over the coming days whenever conditions are suitable to help strengthen our containment lines. An increase in smoke may be visible in the nearby communities.

The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. 

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution. 
  • Residents assessing fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days. 
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2025 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Advice replaces Advice issued on 1.17pm, 30 December 2024. Burning out operations may be undertaken over the coming days whenever conditions are suitable to help strengthen our containment lines. An increase in smoke may be visible in the nearby communities. The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Strathmerton.

  • There is a grassfire at Murray Valley Hwy, Strathmerton that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is travelling from the Murray Valley Highway in a northerly direction towards Bearii East Road. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • Review your fire survival plan.
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. Find information on protecting yourself and your family: https://www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/am-i-at-risk/grassfires-rural.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2025 03:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35587/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Strathmerton.

- There is a grassfire at Murray Valley Hwy, Strathmerton that is not yet under control.
- This grassfire is travelling from the Murray Valley Highway in a northerly direction towards Bearii East Road. 


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Telford, Wilby, Yarrawonga South.

  • There are bales of straw burning at  Benalla-Yarrawonga Rd, Yarrawonga South following on from the earlier stubble fire at the same location.
  • These bales may continue to burn until Thursday 2nd January 2025.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This message replaces the Community Information message issued at 9.48am Tuesday 31st December 2024.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35563/moreinfo

- There are bales of straw burning at  Benalla-Yarrawonga Rd, Yarrawonga South following on from the earlier stubble fire at the same location.
- These bales may continue to burn until Thursday 2nd January 2025.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
- This message replaces the Community Information message issued at 9.48am Tuesday 31st December 2024.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Bellfield Settlement, Bornes Hill, Halls Gap, Jimmy Creek, Watgania, Bellfield
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania. 

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 3.10pm, 30th December 2024.  

Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 

  • If returning to the fire affected area, proceed with caution.
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. 
  • The fire situation can change at any time, you must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. No access is permitted to the National Park. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. 
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area. 

Recovery and Resilience 
If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.   

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone),and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 

  • Residents accessing fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days . 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 02/01/2025 05:10 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Threat is Reduced - Monitor Conditions Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Tuesday 31 December 2024, 05:06 pm Next Update: Thursday 02 January 2025, 05:10 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35571/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania. This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act issued at 3.10pm, 30th December 2024. Residents only are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. - If returning to the fire affected area, proceed with caution. - The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now. - The fire situation can change at any time, you must monitor conditions and be ready to act. Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. No access is permitted to the National Park. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mountain Bay, Macs Cove, Bonnie Doon, Piries
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for the Delatite Arm Reserve campsites, Bonnie Doon, Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mountain Bay, Piries, Macs Cove.

  • There is a bushfire at Delatite Arm Reserve that is not yet under control at Highett Ridge Track.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions, in case they change. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities, campsites and roads.  
  • Bulldozers and aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Some tracks in the area will be closed to traffic while emergency services respond.  
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 10am 1/1/25 or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

This Advice message is being issued for the Delatite Arm Reserve campsites, Bonnie Doon, Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mountain Bay, Piries, Macs Cove.

- There is a bushfire at Delatite Arm Reserve that is not yet under control at Highett Ridge Track.


There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions, in case they change.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: area from Pomonal and Moyston, including Lake Fyans and Willaura.
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire for the Area from Pomonal and Moyston, including Lake Fyans and Willaura. 

This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 4.54pm, 30th December 2024.

Burning out operations near Halls Gap will be undertaken over the coming days to help strengthen the fire containment lines. An increase in smoke may be visible in Halls Gap and nearby communities.

  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. 
Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. 
No access is permitted to the National Park. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. 
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution. 
  • Residents assessing fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days.
  • Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area, be mindful of the increased traffic. 
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit Better Health website.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.transport.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Threat Is Reduced Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Tuesday 31 December 2024, 07:19 pm Next Update: Sunday 05 January 2025, 07:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35572/moreinfo The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire for the Area from Pomonal and Moyston, including Lake Fyans and Willaura. This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 4.54pm, 30th December 2024. Burning out operations near Halls Gap will be undertaken over the coming days to help strengthen the fire containment lines. An increase in smoke may be visible in Halls Gap and nearby communities. - The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. No access is permitted to the National Park. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:

 Burning out operations may be undertaken over the coming days whenever conditions are suitable to help strengthen our containment lines. An increase in smoke may be visible in the nearby communities.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 5.09pm, 30 December 2024.
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. 
The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors for further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted.

There is currently no threat to this warning area, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Impacted Wildlife - Call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.
Recovery and Resilience 

If you have been / may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution.  
  •  Residents assessing fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed due to tree risk. Crews will be undertaking assessment and treatment over the coming days.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Howitt Plains. 

  • This Community Information replaces the Advice message issued at 4:38pm Tuesday 30th of December.
  • There is a bushfire at 22Km Se Of Mount Buller that is under control.
  • Firefighters have contained this fire.
  • This will be the last message for this fire.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 01/01/2025 02:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
